subject: Re: [junit] Re: What's the deal with the frog?
msgSnippet: ... I ve often thought a Tested with JUnit graphic would be cool.  If you saw it on a project s web page, for example, then you d assume there were JUnit
messageBody:
Scott Stirling wrote:

>Maybe we should have a contest to come up with a better frog, or have a vote
>to do away with the frog and come up with a cool logo for JUnit, like they
>do for a lot of the Jakarta projects.
>

I've often thought a "Tested with JUnit" graphic would be cool. If you
saw it on a project's web page, for example, then you'd assume there
were JUnit tests you could run. Perhaps that graphic could be a
recognizable variation of the standard logo.

Mike

--
Mike Clark
